examples: Since he was color blind he was unable to discriminate between the blue and green bottles.

definitions.definition: To treat or affect differently, depending on differences in traits.
examples: Low self-esteem can affect both rich and poor people: it doesn't discriminate .

subdefinitions.definition: To make decisions harmful to (a person or group) based on prejudice .
examples: The law prohibits discriminating against people based on their skin color.

subdefinitions.definition: To infringe upon (a person's rights) in a prejudicial manner.

definitions.definition: To set apart as being different; to mark as different; to separate from another by discerning differences; to distinguish.

secondary_definitions: To treat or affect differently, depending on differences in traits.
( transitive ) To set apart as being different; to mark as different; to separate from another by discerning differences; to distinguish.
